DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to see which dose of epidural neostigmine is the best additive to use with the numbing medication used in an epidural during labor.
DOC.detailed_description: This study is examining the use of the non-narcotic medication, neostigmine, in combination with the local anesthetic bupivacaine when compared with the commonly used narcotic fentanyl in providing pain relief with the fewest side effects in labor analgesia.
DOC.criteria: Healthy pregnancy Term pregnancy ( > 37 weeks) Primiparous or multiparous Induction or spontaneous labor greater or = 18 years of age Cervical exam on entry </=5 cm Weight > 115 kg NonEnglish speaking IV analgesics within 60 minutes prior to epidural being administered Allergy to local anesthetics or neostigmine
DOC.keyword: Non narcotic treatment of labor pain
